message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you our premium product, which I believe would greatly benefit your business. Given its high value to you, I propose a starting price of $1,200,000. This reflects not only the product's worth but also the strategic advantage it offers. Let me know if this aligns with your expectations, and we can proceed from there.

Alice, your offer is a good starting point, but I'm looking to get a better deal. I'm confident this product will be a great asset, but I'm willing to pay a maximum of $1,050,000 for it. This price reflects the value I see in the product while still giving you a decent profit. Let's see if we can find common ground.

Thank you for your response, Bob. I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. Considering the strategic importance of the product to your business, I would like to counter your offer by suggesting a price of $1,150,000. This amount reflects both the product's value and the opportunity cost for us. I hope this proposal will be more acceptable and allows us to move forward towards a mutually beneficial agreement.

Alice, I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but $1,150,000 is still a bit higher than I'm comfortable with.  Given the value I see in this product and the benefits it will bring to my business, I'm willing to go up to $1,100,000. I believe this price is fair and allows both of us to walk away satisfied.

Thank you for your prompt response, Bob. I understand your position and am willing to meet you halfway. Therefore, I propose a price of $1,075,000 for the product. This price reflects the value of the product to both of us and ensures a fair transaction. I hope this proposal will facilitate our agreement and lead to a successful outcome for both parties.
